result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd A Dittberner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Todd A Dittberner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Todd A Dittberner was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Todd A Dittberner was found guilty of Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order dismissing

records.addlTxt: The appeal is hereby dismissed pursuant to Wis Stat Rule 809.83(2)

It is ordered that the appellant shall file a memorandum by 7-26-19 addressing whether he is aggrieved by the granting of his motion for sentence credit and whether the appeal is moot; in the alternative, the appellant may fie a notice of voluntary dismissal.  The filing of the appellant's brief is stayed; if this court confirms jurisdiction, the appellant's brief is due forty days from the order confirming jurisdiction.  The $195 filing fee shall be paid or a petition seeking waiver of the filing fee filed on or before July 26, 2019.
Record filed on July 2, 2019

Court negated its ruling. Atty. Martinez requested time to talk to his client. Court adjourned 1:15 p.m. Recalled at 1:27 p.m., defendant present now. Atty. Judge addressed defendant. Current bonds continued.

Defendant Todd A Dittberner in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called: 15CF171, 15CF69, 14CF220, 14CF304, 14CF561, & 13CM530.   In 15CF171 $2500.00 signature bond.  Standard felony conditions.  No contact with A.H. or her residence.
